meanings.definition: Sparing or limited in quantity or extent
meanings.sent1: The scrimpit amount of food left in the fridge was barely enough for a small snack.
meanings.sent2: She lived a scrimpit life, saving every penny for a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The scrimpit squirrel tried to fit a large acorn into its tiny mouth.
meanings.sent4: Her scrimpit collection of books could fit on just one small shelf.
meanings.sent5: The scrimpit amount of sunlight peeking through the clouds made the room feel cozy.

meanings.definition: To be stingy or frugal in spending or using resources
meanings.sent1: He would scrimpit on electricity by using candles instead of turning on the lights.
meanings.sent2: She scrimpted on water by taking quick showers and turning off the tap while brushing her teeth.
meanings.sent3: The family scrimpted on paper towels by using cloth napkins for spills.
meanings.sent4: She scrimpted on time, trying to fit too many tasks into one day.
meanings.sent5: The company scrimpted on employee benefits to save money for expansion.
